title: Free China Review
additional-notes: This is a Taiwanese publication. Its contents may still be copyrighted even without renewals or copyright notices, if they meet GATT copyright restoration requirements for works first published outside the US. US cities are named as publication or distribution locations in some issues.

Spot-checks of issues from the 1950s and 1980s did not turn up copyright notices, though the Copyright Office records registrations from August 1988 onward.  A note in the January 1987 issue says 'Reproduction or republication of articles from the Free China Review is expeditiously granted without fee, upon request.... The editors request an information copy of all reprints, and proper source credits to individual authors and photographers and the Free China Review.'
acknowledgement: Thanks to Shelton Henderson for copyright research on this title.
